page.title: 14ST. MARGARET'S CHURCH.
page.content: The{Parish church in Denton}dates back to the 13th century but was largely rebuilt and Victorianised 600 years later. Over 60 years ago, a choir boy carefully studied the tracts of distemper on the featureless walls inside the church. In 1970,{Henry Bird the same choir boy and well-known painter exhibited huge cartoons at the Guildhall in Northampton. Proposals for the{redecoration}of the Denton Church showed, for instance, an abortive attempt by water board officials to demolish the village pump; however, 3 angry local ladies had other ideas. Other notable scenes depict a Saxon paying homage to a Norman with the{village's dovecote}in the background and a collection of Biblical characters with faces of local villagers.
